title: Watch Cardinals' foul ball go fair against Giants thanks to crazy spin
text:
One of the best things about baseball is how weird it is.

There really isn't much more to say to tee up this ... well, strange play during Tuesday's Giants-Cardinals game:

Gonna need someone to explain how this is even possible 🤯 pic.twitter.com/rWLiLeOpry — SF Giants on NBCS (@NBCSGiants) September 4, 2019

Scroll to continue with content Ad

This was ruled a "soft ground ball" and a single off the bat of Paul DeJong in the bottom of the first, but it's clearly a bit more than that.

As a matter of fact, the ball was so deep into foul territory, nobody on the field appeared to go after it -- and that's fair, theoretically speaking.

Even the Cards dugout was pumped on the strange play:

Whatever helps, we suppose. But while it was bad luck for the Giants, pitcher Dereck Rodriguez got out of the jam with no harm done.

Watch Cardinals' foul ball go fair against Giants thanks to crazy spin originally appeared on NBC Sports Bay Area
description: This has to be the strangest thing you will see all day.
